name: Ghana Employee Handbook / HR Policy
description: A comprehensive HR policy document that incorporates mandatory provisions of the Ghana Labour Act, 2003 (Maternity, Sick Leave, SSNIT).

clauses.clause_text: Welcome to {{company_name}}. This handbook outlines our policies and your rights as an employee. Where this handbook conflicts with Act 651, the Act shall prevail.
Standard working hours are from {{start_time}} to {{end_time}}, Monday to Friday. This exceeds the legal maximum of 40 hours per week only in accordance with overtime provisions agreed herein.

Female employees are entitled to {{maternity_weeks}} weeks (minimum 12 weeks) of fully paid maternity leave. Nursing mothers are entitled to one hour off daily during working hours for breastfeeding for a period of one year.
The Employer is registered with SSNIT (No: {{ssnit_number}}) and Tier 2 schemes. Contributions are deducted and remitted monthly in accordance with the National Pensions Act, 2008 (Act 766).

The following acts constitute gross misconduct: (a) Theft or fraud; (b) Violence in the workplace; (c) Chronic absenteeism; (d) Breach of confidentiality. Disciplinary actions follow the principle of natural justice.
